विश्वेषां पुरि पुरि यत्सदैव शेषे विद्वद्भिः पुरुष इति प्रतीयसे तत् । किं धामत्रितयमयानपायदृष्टेस्तस्मात्ते जगति परोक्षमस्ति वस्तु ॥ १८ ॥ viśveṣāṃ puri puri yatsadaiva śeṣe vidvadbhiḥ puruṣa iti pratīyase tat | kiṃ dhāmatritayamayānapāyadṛṣṭestasmātte jagati parokṣamasti vastu || 18 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
नन्वेवं(कं) किमपि विनिर्मलं प्रकृत्या त्वद्रूपं सुरसरिदम्बुवत्पुनीते । स्रोतोभिस्त्रिभिरथ कारणात्मभिस्तद्विश्वात्मन्कृतकमपि व्यनक्ति भेदम् ॥ nanvevaṃ(kaṃ) kimapi vinirmalaṃ prakṛtyā tvadrūpaṃ surasaridambuvatpunīte | srotobhistribhiratha kāraṇātmabhistadviśvātmankṛtakamapi vyanakti bhedam || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
धिङ्मूढा वितथमुदासनस्वभावं भाषन्ते पुरुष तव त्रिलोकभर्तुः । कर्त्री चेत्प्रकृतिरियं करोतु किञ्चित्कैवल्यं भवदधिरोहमन्तरेण ॥ २० ॥ dhiṅmūḍhā vitathamudāsanasvabhāvaṃ bhāṣante puruṣa tava trilokabhartuḥ | kartrī cetprakṛtiriyaṃ karotu kiñcitkaivalyaṃ bhavadadhirohamantareṇa || 20 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
किं मिथ्या हर महदादिषु प्रयुङ्क्ते लोकोऽयं विकृतिमयेषु तत्त्वशब्दम् । एकस्त्वं निरुपधि(निरवधि)रूपभृद्धि तथ्यं तत्तत्त्वं पुरुष बिभर्षि पञ्चविंशः ॥ २१ ॥ kiṃ mithyā hara mahadādiṣu prayuṅkte loko'yaṃ vikṛtimayeṣu tattvaśabdam | ekastvaṃ nirupadhi(niravadhi)rūpabhṛddhi tathyaṃ tattattvaṃ puruṣa bibharṣi pañcaviṃśaḥ || 21 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
किं कर्तुं तव पुरतोऽथ किं नु वक्तुं शक्ष्यामः क्षितिधरराजमूर्धशायिन् । त्वं खण्डं क्वचिदपि नो पदं व्यनक्षि त्रैलोक्यं ध्वनिवपुषश्च ते विवर्तः॥ २२ ॥ kiṃ kartuṃ tava purato'tha kiṃ nu vaktuṃ śakṣyāmaḥ kṣitidhararājamūrdhaśāyin | tvaṃ khaṇḍaṃ kvacidapi no padaṃ vyanakṣi trailokyaṃ dhvanivapuṣaśca te vivartaḥ|| 22 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कुत्रापि प्रतिहतिमेति नान्तरिक्षं शब्दस्तद्गुणपदवीं न चातिशेते । तन्मूर्तिस्त्वमसि च तद्विभो जगन्ति व्याप्नोषीत्ययमुपपत्तिसम्प्रदायः ॥ २३ ॥ kutrāpi pratihatimeti nāntarikṣaṃ śabdastadguṇapadavīṃ na cātiśete | tanmūrtistvamasi ca tadvibho jaganti vyāpnoṣītyayamupapattisampradāyaḥ || 23 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
नो किञ्चिद्बहिरुपपत्तिमेति वस्तु ज्ञानात्तत्प्रसरति किन्तु चित्रवृत्ति । ज्ञानात्मा प्रभुरिति विश्वकर्तृभावो नो बौद्धैरपि भवतो बत व्यपास्त: ॥ २४ ॥ no kiñcidbahirupapattimeti vastu jñānāttatprasarati kintu citravṛtti | jñānātmā prabhuriti viśvakartṛbhāvo no bauddhairapi bhavato bata vyapāstaḥ || 24 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
शून्यं तैरकथि न तुच्छमेव रूपं मादृक्षानधिगमनीयवृत्ति किं तु । तादृक्षं तव च वपुस्तथा च बौद्धास्त्वामेव क्व न परमार्थतो गृणन्ति ॥ २५ ॥ śūnyaṃ tairakathi na tucchameva rūpaṃ mādṛkṣānadhigamanīyavṛtti kiṃ tu | tādṛkṣaṃ tava ca vapustathā ca bauddhāstvāmeva kva na paramārthato gṛṇanti || 25 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
बोधात्मन्यनवधितां त्वयीह जानन्त्यन्यानि त्रिनयन सन्तु दर्शनानि । आत्मा त्वं तव च वपुस्त्रयोऽपि लोकास्तन्मानं त्वमिति च नार्हतोऽस्ति गर्हा॥ २६ ॥ bodhātmanyanavadhitāṃ tvayīha jānantyanyāni trinayana santu darśanāni | ātmā tvaṃ tava ca vapustrayo'pi lokāstanmānaṃ tvamiti ca nārhato'sti garhā|| 26 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
त्रैलोक्यं विभजति यो विचित्रतत्रं यस्माच्च प्रसरति सर्वजीवलोकः । चार्वाकास्तमिह वदन्ति यत्स्वभावं तद्भङ्ग्या त्वमसि शिवोररीकृतस्तैः ॥ २७ ॥ trailokyaṃ vibhajati yo vicitratatraṃ yasmācca prasarati sarvajīvalokaḥ | cārvākāstamiha vadanti yatsvabhāvaṃ tadbhaṅgyā tvamasi śivorarīkṛtastaiḥ || 27 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
यं माया क्वचिदनिरुद्ध्यमानरूपा न स्प्रष्टुं प्रभवति नेति नेति सन्तः । यस्मिंश्च व्यवहृतिमाचरन्ति तं त्वां तात्पर्यादुपनिषदो विभो गृणन्ति ॥ २८ ॥ yaṃ māyā kvacidaniruddhyamānarūpā na spraṣṭuṃ prabhavati neti neti santaḥ | yasmiṃśca vyavahṛtimācaranti taṃ tvāṃ tātparyādupaniṣado vibho gṛṇanti || 28 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
एकस्त्वं त्रिनयन दृश्यसेऽधिकर्तुं ज्ञातुं च त्रिभुवनमीश्वरः प्रकाशः । तादात्म्यं विवृतवती विमर्शशक्तिद्वैधेऽपि प्रथयति ते न भेददोषम् ॥ २९ ॥ ekastvaṃ trinayana dṛśyase'dhikartuṃ jñātuṃ ca tribhuvanamīśvaraḥ prakāśaḥ | tādātmyaṃ vivṛtavatī vimarśaśaktidvaidhe'pi prathayati te na bhedadoṣam || 29 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
इच्छद्भिः शशिमुकुट क्रियैकरूपं वैवश्याप्रणयविधायिनं वि(नि)योगम् । निर्यूढश्रुतिकविकृत्य विश्वकर्ता त्वं हर्ताभ्युपगत एव वेदविद्भिः॥ ३० ॥ icchadbhiḥ śaśimukuṭa kriyaikarūpaṃ vaivaśyāpraṇayavidhāyinaṃ vi(ni)yogam | niryūḍhaśrutikavikṛtya viśvakartā tvaṃ hartābhyupagata eva vedavidbhiḥ|| 30 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
यच्छायापृषदभिषेकतोऽपि सर्वे तात्पर्यादवसितजाड्यतां भजन्ते । तस्यात्मंस्तव जडतामुदीरयन्तः काणादा बत न कथञ्चन त्रपन्ते ॥ ३१ ॥ yacchāyāpṛṣadabhiṣekato’pi sarve tātparyādavasitajāḍyatāṃ bhajante | tasyātmaṃstava jaḍatāmudīrayantaḥ kāṇādā bata na kathañcana trapante || 31 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
क्वावत्स्यत्कथमजनिष्यत प्रकाशं प्राणिष्यत्कथमथवैष जीवलोकः । आ सर्गादखिलजगद्गरिष्ठ नो चेत्कारुण्यात्प्रभुरभविष्यदष्टमूर्तिः ॥ ३२ ॥ kvāvatsyatkathamajaniṣyata prakāśaṃ prāṇiṣyatkathamathavaiṣa jīvalokaḥ | ā sargādakhilajagadgariṣṭha no cetkāruṇyātprabhurabhaviṣyadaṣṭamūrtiḥ || 32 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
वक्त्रेऽभूत्तव मुरजित्प्रतिग्रहीता त्वं ग्रीवां सरसिजजन्मनो व्यलावीः । इत्थं ते हिमकरशेखर प्रसादः कोपो वा क्व​चिदजनिष्ट नो महत्सु ॥ ३३ ॥ vaktre’bhūttava murajitpratigrahītā tvaṃ grīvāṃ sarasijajanmano vyalāvīḥ | itthaṃ te himakaraśekhara prasādaḥ kopo vā kvacidajaniṣṭa no mahatsu || 33 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
इत्यादिस्तुतिमुखरेषु निर्जरेषु प्रत्यग्रप्रसृतकृपारसातिरेकः। तानित्थं कथयितुमिन्दुखण्डचूडः प्रारेभे रभसवशंवदैर्वचोभिः ॥ ३४ ॥ ityādistutimukhareṣu nirjareṣu pratyagraprasṛtakṛpārasātirekaḥ| tānitthaṃ kathayitumindukhaṇḍacūḍaḥ prārebhe rabhasavaśaṃvadairvacobhiḥ || 34 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
प्राप्तानां मम सविधं विधूतधैर्या चर्यासौ विपुलमुपप्लवं व्यनक्ति । विश्लिष्यन्निजमहसां मुखानि यद्वः प्रातस्त्यं रजनिपतिं विडम्बयन्ति ॥ ३५ ॥ prāptānāṃ mama savidhaṃ vidhūtadhairyā caryāsau vipulamupaplavaṃ vyanakti | viśliṣyannijamahasāṃ mukhāni yadvaḥ prātastyaṃ rajanipatiṃ viḍambayanti || 35 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
विश्वापद्गदभिषजोऽपि किं भवन्तो वैक्लव्यव्यसनविसंस्थुलाननाः स्थ । प्रत्यर्थिप्रधनरसा विलङ्घय दैन्यं तेजो वस्तुलयति वाडवं हि धाम ॥ ३६ ॥ viśvāpadgadabhiṣajo'pi kiṃ bhavanto vaiklavyavyasanavisaṃsthulānanāḥ stha | pratyarthipradhanarasā vilaṅghaya dainyaṃ tejo vastulayati vāḍavaṃ hi dhāma || 36 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
ध्यानेन स्तिमिततमत्वमब्जयोनेरासीद्यत्प्रणिहितदीक्षमीक्षणेषु । चिन्तायाः परिचयने तदेव सद्यः साधिक्यक्रममपि नाधिकं धिनोति ॥ ३७ ॥ dhyānena stimitatamatvamabjayonerāsīdyatpraṇihitadīkṣamīkṣaṇeṣu | cintāyāḥ paricayane tadeva sadyaḥ sādhikyakramamapi nādhikaṃ dhinoti || 37 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
सावेगं युधि वलतां द्विषां शिरोभिर्यस्याग्रे समजनि मृत्युभाण्डभङ्गिः। तच्चकं क्रशिमवशंवदाग्रिमार्चिःसञ्चारं किमिति मुरद्विषोऽधिशेते॥ ३८ ॥ sāvegaṃ yudhi valatāṃ dviṣāṃ śirobhiryasyāgre samajani mṛtyubhāṇḍabhaṅgiḥ | taccakaṃ kraśimavaśaṃvadāgrimārciḥsañcāraṃ kimiti muradviṣo'dhiśete|| 38 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
यत्र श्रीरनिशविनिद्रदृक्सहस्रे विश्रम्य स्मरति न पङ्कजाकरस्य । सोऽकाण्डे किमिति बिडौजसोऽस्य देहः सन्देहं मुहुरिव कस्य न व्यनक्ति ॥ ३९ ॥ yatra śrīraniśavinidradṛksahasre viśramya smarati na paṅkajākarasya | so'kāṇḍe kimiti biḍaujaso'sya dehaḥ sandehaṃ muhuriva kasya na vyanakti || 39 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
चित्रोद्यत्क्रशिमविशेषवद्भिरङ्गैर्वैक्लव्यं विवृतवतां समीरणानाम् । किं त्वेषां पुनरपि जायते महद्भिर्निः​श्वासैरनलसमांसलत्वयोगः ॥ ४० ॥ citrodyatkraśimaviśeṣavadbhiraṅgairvaiklavyaṃ vivṛtavatāṃ samīraṇānām | kiṃ tveṣāṃ punarapi jāyate mahadbhirniḥśvāsairanalasamāṃsalatvayogaḥ || 40 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
पाण्डिम्ना परिचितमुज्झितप्रतापप्रावारं किमिति तथा वपुः ख​रांशोः । शुभ्रांशुभ्रमघटनाद्विना त्रियामामातङ्कं सृजति यथा रथाङ्गनाम्नाम् ॥ ४१ ॥ pāṇḍimnā paricitamujjhitapratāpaprāvāraṃ kimiti tathā vapuḥ kharāṃśoḥ | śubhrāṃśubhramaghaṭanādvinā triyāmāmātaṅkaṃ sṛjati yathā rathāṅganāmnām || 41 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
निःशेषत्रिभुवनघस्मरश्रितत्वात्तद्वह्नेः सहजमपह्नुतं क्व तेजः। युष्माकं सपदि विलोक्यतेऽस्य हा धिक्शोकोष्णश्वसिततरङ्गमात्रशेषः॥ ४२ ॥ niḥśeṣatribhuvanaghasmaraśritatvāttadvahneḥ sahajamapahnutaṃ kva tejaḥ| yuṣmākaṃ sapadi vilokyate'sya hā dhikśokoṣṇaśvasitataraṅgamātraśeṣaḥ|| 42 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
क्रान्ताभिः प्रतिदिवसास्तशैलसीदच्चण्डांशुद्युतिभिरिवेश्वरः प्रतीच्याः । यस्तेजो दुरभिभवं बभार सद्यः स्वां शक्तिं दृशि विधृताम्भसि व्यनक्ति ॥ ४३ ॥ krāntābhiḥ pratidivasāstaśailasīdaccaṇḍāṃśudyutibhiriveśvaraḥ pratīcyāḥ | yastejo durabhibhavaṃ babhāra sadyaḥ svāṃ śaktiṃ dṛśi vidhṛtāmbhasi vyanakti || 43 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
अन्येषां सवनलिहामपि प्रयातः स प्राच्यः क्व नु निजतेजसोऽतिरेकः । नीरन्ध्रप्रविसृमराननानिलौघैः किं लीढः कथमपि दीपवच्छमेन ॥ ४४ ॥ anyeṣāṃ savanalihāmapi prayātaḥ sa prācyaḥ kva nu nijatejaso'tirekaḥ | nīrandhrapravisṛmarānanānilaughaiḥ kiṃ līḍhaḥ kathamapi dīpavacchamena || 44 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
ईदृग्भिः स्मरमकरैकमान्त्रिकस्य व्याहारैरपहृतकल्पचित्तपीडाः । निर्वेदाद(न)भिमुखलोचनं कथञ्चित्प्रोत्क्षिप्य क्षणमवतस्थिरे मुखानि ॥ ४१ ॥ īdṛgbhiḥ smaramakaraikamāntrikasya vyāhārairapahṛtakalpacittapīḍāḥ | nirvedāda(na)bhimukhalocanaṃ kathañcitprotkṣipya kṣaṇamavatasthire mukhāni || 41 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
देवोऽथ श्रुतिकविता पयोदनादप्रत्यर्थिस्वनरचनाञ्चितैर्वचोभिः । हंसानां रथपथवर्तिनां मुहूर्तं तन्वानो भयमिति सादरं जगाद ॥ ४६ ॥ devo'tha śrutikavitā payodanādapratyarthisvanaracanāñcitairvacobhiḥ | haṃsānāṃ rathapathavartināṃ muhūrtaṃ tanvāno bhayamiti sādaraṃ jagāda || 46 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
सन्तापं किमपि विवृण्वते न केषां ये पादा इव दिविषन्मनोज्वरस्य । सन्त्यत्र त्रिनयन दुःसहप्रमेया दैतेयास्त्रिभुवनशत्रवस्त्रयस्ते ॥ ४७ ॥ santāpaṃ kimapi vivṛṇvate na keṣāṃ ye pādā iva diviṣanmanojvarasya | santyatra trinayana duḥsahaprameyā daiteyāstribhuvanaśatravastrayaste || 47 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
प्रागुद्यद्यमनियमादिमांसलाभिश्चेष्टाभिस्त्रिदिवमुनीन्विलङ्घयन्तः । संहत्य स्थिरतरनिश्चयेन ते मामाराद्धुं निरवधि तेपिरे तपांसि ॥ ४८ ॥ prāgudyadyamaniyamādimāṃsalābhiśceṣṭābhistridivamunīnvilaṅghayantaḥ | saṃhatya sthirataraniścayena te māmārāddhuṃ niravadhi tepire tapāṃsi || 48 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
त्रैलोक्यं तपसि विशङ्कमेव तेषां कल्पान्तज्वलननयेन बाधमाने । निर्व्याजक्रममथ दर्शनं पुरस्तात्तेभ्योऽहं व्यतरमनुत्तरानुरोधः ॥ ४९ ॥ trailokyaṃ tapasi viśaṅkameva teṣāṃ kalpāntajvalananayena bādhamāne | nirvyājakramamatha darśanaṃ purastāttebhyo'haṃ vyataramanuttarānurodhaḥ || 49 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
सन्तप्ते वपुषि तपोभरेण कुर्वन्निर्वाणं वहनपतत्त्रिपत्रवातैः । सावेगं पटु घटिताञ्जलीन्पुरस्तात्तानाविष्कृतनिजमूर्तिरित्यवोचम् ॥ ५० ॥ santapte vapuṣi tapobhareṇa kurvannirvāṇaṃ vahanapatattripatravātaiḥ | sāvegaṃ paṭu ghaṭitāñjalīnpurastāttānāviṣkṛtanijamūrtirityavocam || 50 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
सन्तु(न्त​​)ष्टं निशिततपोविशेषमय्या वास्या वः सकलमपीह गात्रतन्त्रम् । युष्मभ्यं वरमहमीप्सितं प्रदास्ये भो वत्सा खलु विरचय्य तद्व्रतानि ॥ ५१ ॥ santu(nta)ṣṭaṃ niśitatapoviśeṣamayyā vāsyā vaḥ sakalamapīha gātratantram | yuṣmabhyaṃ varamahamīpsitaṃ pradāsye bho vatsā khalu viracayya tadvratāni || 51 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
ईदृक्षप्रतततपःपणप्रयुक्त्या यं प्राप्तुं विवृतदुरोदरक्रियाः स्थ । अर्थं तं कथयत तत्र कापि मा भूदाशङ्का दितिकुलमौलिमण्डना वः॥ ५२ ॥ īdṛkṣapratatatapaḥpaṇaprayuktyā yaṃ prāptuṃ vivṛtadurodarakriyāḥ stha | arthaṃ taṃ kathayata tatra kāpi mā bhūdāśaṅkā ditikulamaulimaṇḍanā vaḥ|| 52 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
इत्यस्मद्गिरमधिरोप्य कर्णवीथीं नेदीयः प्र(यःप्र​)मदरसोक्षितेक्षणास्ते । मामेवं विनयमपा(या)क्षरान्तरङ्गप्रोन्मीलत्पदमगदन्विनम्रकण्ठम् ॥ ५३ ॥ ityasmadgiramadhiropya karṇavīthīṃ nedīyaḥ pra(yaḥpra)madarasokṣitekṣaṇāste | māmevaṃ vinayamapā(yā)kṣarāntaraṅgapronmīlatpadamagadanvinamrakaṇṭham || 53 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
अन्यैः किं वरद वरान्तरैरवाप्तैरप्राप्तैरथ च न कोऽपि यैर्विशेषः । त्वद्वक्त्रप्रसृतवचोमृतौघलाभादस्माकं भवतु विभो झगित्यमृत्युः ॥ ५४ ॥ anyaiḥ kiṃ varada varāntarairavāptairaprāptairatha ca na ko'pi yairviśeṣaḥ | tvadvaktraprasṛtavacomṛtaughalābhādasmākaṃ bhavatu vibho jhagityamṛtyuḥ || 54 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
नैवेदं वितरितुमीश्वरोऽस्ति कश्चिन्निश्चित्य द्रुतमितरं वरं वृणीध्वम् । इत्यस्मद्वचनमथोच्चुलुम्प्य तेऽत्र श्रोत्राभ्यां पुनरिदमादरादवोचन् ॥ ५५ ॥ naivedaṃ vitaritumīśvaro'sti kaścinniścitya drutamitaraṃ varaṃ vṛṇīdhvam | ityasmadvacanamathocculumpya te'tra śrotrābhyāṃ punaridamādarādavocan || 55 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
नैवं चेत्प्रतिशृणुते भवानकस्मादस्मभ्यं दृढतपसापि निःसहेभ्यः । तर्ह्येको युधि रिपुणा शरोऽर्प्यमाणः सर्वेषां भवतु सहैव मृत्यवे नः ॥ ५६ ॥ naivaṃ cetpratiśṛṇute bhavānakasmādasmabhyaṃ dṛḍhatapasāpi niḥsahebhyaḥ | tarhyeko yudhi ripuṇā śaro'rpyamāṇaḥ sarveṣāṃ bhavatu sahaiva mṛtyave naḥ || 56 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
मत्तस्तं वरमिति दीप्तमाप्तवन्तस्ते युक्त्या मतिमतिवर्तितुं यमस्य । त्रींल्लोकानथ च पृथक्पृथङ्निरोद्धुं सन्नद्धा व्यधिषत नूत्नयत्नसिद्धिम् ॥ ५७ ॥ mattastaṃ varamiti dīptamāptavantaste yuktyā matimativartituṃ yamasya | trīṃllokānatha ca pṛthakpṛthaṅniroddhuṃ sannaddhā vyadhiṣata nūtnayatnasiddhim || 57 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
तत्तत्त्वमान्तरमवेत्य ततः सुवर्ण-दुर्वर्णलोहघटनाविकटैः प्रकारैः । तेभ्यः पृथक्त्रिषु जगत्सु पुरीरनल्प-शिल्पाविकल्पसमयः स मयश्चकार ॥ ५८ ॥ tattattvamāntaramavetya tataḥ suvarṇa-durvarṇalohaghaṭanāvikaṭaiḥ prakāraiḥ | tebhyaḥ pṛthaktriṣu jagatsu purīranalpa-śilpāvikalpasamayaḥ sa mayaścakāra || 58 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
अरुणमणिगरीयोगोपुरप्रोज्जिहान-द्युतिनिवहनवीनोदृङ्कितामेयवप्रम् । पुरवरमथ हैमं दैत्यनारीकटाक्षैः कुवलयितगवाक्षं तारकाक्षोऽध्यरुक्षत् ॥ ५९ ॥ aruṇamaṇigarīyogopuraprojjihāna- dyutinivahanavīnodṛṅkitāmeyavapram | puravaramatha haimaṃ daityanārīkaṭākṣaiḥ kuvalayitagavākṣaṃ tārakākṣo'dhyarukṣat || 59 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
धवलभवनयोगादाप्तपर्याप्तसाम्य-श्रिणि नभसि हसन्त्यामुल्लसद्भिर्मयूखैः । पुरि परिकरमाधाद्राजतोल्लासबन्धौ स्वक इव कमलाक्षः प्रक्रमो विक्रमस्य ॥ ६० ॥ dhavalabhavanayogādāptaparyāptasāmya-śriṇi nabhasi hasantyāmullasadbhirmayūkhaiḥ | puri parikaramādhādrājatollāsabandhau svaka iva kamalākṣaḥ prakramo vikramasya || 60 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
भरत्रुट्यत्क्षोणीतलविसृतपातालतिमिर-स्थिरासङ्गेनेव स्फुरदसितनिःशेषवपुषम् । नृणां लोके कालायसमयमया(य​)त्नाज्ज​नपदं ततो विद्युन्मालीत्यसिसलिलधाराभिरसिचत् ॥ ६१ ॥ bharatruṭyatkṣoṇītalavisṛtapātālatimira- sthirāsaṅgeneva sphuradasitaniḥśeṣavapuṣam | nṛṇāṃ loke kālāyasamayamayā(ya)tnājanapadaṃ tato vidyunmālītyasisaliladhārābhirasicat || 61 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
ते प्राप्य त्रिपुरप्रथामथ पृथग्लोकान् रुजन्तः स्थिता दिव्यान्यब्दशतायुतान्युपनमद्विश्वापमृत्युश्रियः । यन्नाम्नाप्यधिरोहता श्रुतिपदं गीर्वाणवामभ्रुवां गाहन्ते तनवोऽतिवेलपवनोद्वेल्लल्लतासौहृदम् ॥ ६२ ॥ te prāpya tripuraprathāmatha pṛthaglokān rujantaḥ sthitā divyānyabdaśatāyutānyupanamadviśvāpamṛtyuśriyaḥ | yannāmnāpyadhirohatā śrutipadaṃ gīrvāṇavāmabhruvāṃ gāhante tanavo'tivelapavanodvellallatāsauhṛdam || 62 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
तापं रुचिक्षतिमथो विविधाश्च पीडा विश्वस्य धातव इवोत्कुपितास्त्रयस्ते । आतन्वते सपदि दुःसहसन्निपाते तस्मिन्भिषक्तु यदि भर्ग भवत्प्रसादः ॥ ६३ ॥ tāpaṃ rucikṣatimatho vividhāśca pīḍā viśvasya dhātava ivotkupitāstrayaste | ātanvate sapadi duḥsahasannipāte tasminbhiṣaktu yadi bharga bhavatprasādaḥ || 63 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
याः क्रीडद्विबुधावरोधनपरिष्कारार्ककान्तानल-ज्वालातापलवावलेहमपि नो मध्येदिनं सेहिरे । ताः सन्तानकवीरुधो विधुनितास्तत्सैनिकैः साम्प्रतं दावाग्निर्यदि नाम रक्षति ततो नीचावमानज्वरात् ॥ ६४ ॥ yāḥ krīḍadvibudhāvarodhanapariṣkārārkakāntānala- jvālātāpalavāvalehamapi no madhyedinaṃ sehire | tāḥ santānakavīrudho vidhunitāstatsainikaiḥ sāmprataṃ dāvāgniryadi nāma rakṣati tato nīcāvamānajvarāt || 64 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
पाशैर्बद्धशिरोधराः फणिमयैरुत्खातनाकिद्रुम-स्कन्धालानतलेषु दानसलिलावग्राहिणो दिग्द्विपाः । नीतास्तैरजिरेषु यामगजतां स्रस्तेऽपि विश्वम्भरा-भारे व्रीडनिपीडनेन दधते दूरावनम्रं शिरः ॥ ६५ ॥ pāśairbaddhaśirodharāḥ phaṇimayairutkhātanākidruma- skandhālānataleṣu dānasalilāvagrāhiṇo digdvipāḥ | nītāstairajireṣu yāmagajatāṃ sraste'pi viśvambharā-bhāre vrīḍanipīḍanena dadhate dūrāvanamraṃ śiraḥ || 65 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
किं वान्यत्ते तथाद्य त्रिनयन विनयातिक्रमाक्रान्तविश्वा निःश्वासौघेन दीर्घीकृतचमरमरुड्डम्बराः स्वर्वधूभिः । सर्वं निर्वीरमुर्वीतलमथ निलयं नाकिनां मन्यमानाः कर्तारो नूनमस्मत्परिकरमचिरान्नाममात्रावशेषम् ॥ ६६ ॥ kiṃ vānyatte tathādya trinayana vinayātikramākrāntaviśvā niḥśvāsaughena dīrghīkṛtacamaramaruḍḍambarāḥ svarvadhūbhiḥ | sarvaṃ nirvīramurvītalamatha nilayaṃ nākināṃ manyamānāḥ kartāro nūnamasmatparikaramacirānnāmamātrāvaśeṣam || 66 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
इत्थं प्रस्तावनायै विवृतवति वचः पद्मभूसूत्रधारे तूर्णं वक्त्रप्रसादप्रसरजवनिकामग्रतोऽपास्य दूरम् । क्रोधाख्यः पर्षदानां विदधदधिमनोरङ्गपीठप्रवेशं शैलूषो दृष्टहस्ताद्यसमविकृतिभिः सङ्गमङ्गीचकार ॥ ६७ ॥ itthaṃ prastāvanāyai vivṛtavati vacaḥ padmabhūsūtradhāre tūrṇaṃ vaktraprasādaprasarajavanikāmagrato'pāsya dūram | krodhākhyaḥ parṣadānāṃ vidadhadadhimanoraṅgapīṭhapraveśaṃ śailūṣo dṛṣṭahastādyasamavikṛtibhiḥ saṅgamaṅgīcakāra || 67 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
इति श्रीजोनराजकृतया टीकया समेतः श्रीराजानकविश्ववर्तसूनोर्महाकविराजराजानकश्रीमङ्खकस्य कृतौ श्रीकण्ठचरिते महाकाव्ये परमेश्वरदेवसमागमवर्णनं नाम सप्तदशः सर्गः ॥ अष्टादशः सर्गः ॥ दैत्योदयासवरसं श्रवणानुतर्ष-मार्गेण ते गणगणा विनिपीतवन्तः । रज्यद्विलोचनकपोलतलाः स्खलद्भि-र्वाक्यैर्विलोलवलितभ्रु विकारमूहुः ॥ १ ॥ daityodayāsavarasaṃ śravaṇānutarṣa-mārgeṇa te gaṇagaṇā vinipītavantaḥ | rajyadvilocanakapolatalāḥ skhaladbhi-rvākyairvilolavalitabhru vikāramūhuḥ || 1 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
तेऽक्षिभ्रुवभ्रमिकरालतरालिकाग्र-माजघ्निरे करतलैर्घनमंसकूटम् । यत्सम्भ्रमेण विदलत्कनकोर्मिकोत्थं चक्रे रजः पृथुविलोचनकूणितानि ॥ २ ॥ te'kṣibhruvabhramikarālatarālikāgra-mājaghnire karatalairghanamaṃsakūṭam | yatsambhrameṇa vidalatkanakormikotthaṃ cakre rajaḥ pṛthuvilocanakūṇitāni || 2 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
प्राथम्यतः प्रमथवीरजनः सकोप-निष्पिष्यमाणविविधाभरणाग्रचूर्णैः । उद्दामदानवजनरस्य पुरन्ध्रिदृष्टे-रश्रुप्रथार्थमिव धूलिभरं पुपोष ॥ ३ ॥ prāthamyataḥ pramathavīrajanaḥ sakopa-niṣpiṣyamāṇavividhābharaṇāgracūrṇaiḥ | uddāmadānavajanarasya purandhridṛṣṭe-raśruprathārthamiva dhūlibharaṃ pupoṣa || 3 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
साटोपपाणिमृदितस्वविलासहार-तारेन्द्रनीलनिबिरीसरजश्छटाभिः । व्यानञ्ज कश्चन पुरोन्तरदीप्यमान-कोपप्रदीपगलदञ्जनधूलिपुञ्जम् ॥ ४ ॥ sāṭopapāṇimṛditasvavilāsahāra-tārendranīlanibirīsarajaśchaṭābhiḥ | vyānañja kaścana purontaradīpyamāna-kopapradīpagaladañjanadhūlipuñjam || 4 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
अन्योन्यमर्दनरयादुदितासमोष्म-ताम्रीभवद्विधृतधूमशिखोद्गमं च । कस्यापि पाणियुगलं स्वभुजप्रताप-वह्नेर्विनिर्गमनमार्गमिवाचचक्षे ॥ ५ ॥ anyonyamardanarayāduditāsamoṣma-tāmrībhavadvidhṛtadhūmaśikhodgamaṃ ca | kasyāpi pāṇiyugalaṃ svabhujapratāpa-vahnervinirgamanamārgamivācacakṣe || 5 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
केनाप्यभज्यत तथा पृथुपद्मराग-चूडामणिर्निबिडपाणिविघट्टनाभिः । नासीद्यथोल्लसति तद्रजसि प्रसक्त-रोषारुणाननरुचः परभागलाभः ॥ ६ ॥ kenāpyabhajyata tathā pṛthupadmarāga-cūḍāmaṇirnibiḍapāṇivighaṭṭanābhiḥ | nāsīdyathollasati tadrajasi prasakta-roṣāruṇānanarucaḥ parabhāgalābhaḥ || 6 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कश्चिद्विशङ्कटपटुभ्रुकुटीकराल-भालस्थलः किमपि घोरतरं बभाषे । नीतो रुषा कलुषतां स हठात्प्रवीरो वाचां कथं त्वपरुषं प्रसरं व्यनक्तु ॥ ७ ॥ kaścidviśaṅkaṭapaṭubhrukuṭīkarāla-bhālasthalaḥ kimapi ghorataraṃ babhāṣe | nīto ruṣā kaluṣatāṃ sa haṭhātpravīro vācāṃ kathaṃ tvaparuṣaṃ prasaraṃ vyanaktu || 7 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कस्यापि तत्समयसम्भ्रमदूरदीर्ण-जीर्णव्रणप्रणयिनी तनुराबभासे । द्रष्टुं भ्रुवोरसमलास्यरहस्यदीक्षां वीरश्रिया कृतगवाक्षपरम्परेव ॥ ८ ॥ kasyāpi tatsamayasambhramadūradīrṇa-jīrṇavraṇapraṇayinī tanurābabhāse | draṣṭuṃ bhruvorasamalāsyarahasyadīkṣāṃ vīraśriyā kṛtagavākṣaparampareva || 8 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
क्रोधानुबन्धघनघर्मविकीर्यमाण-विस्तीर्णदीर्णजरठव्रणविभ्रमेण । कूपावलीर्विपुलवीररसाः प्रतापं हर्तुं द्विषामिव च कश्चन सञ्चिकाय ॥ ९ ॥ krodhānubandhaghanagharmavikīryamāṇa-vistīrṇadīrṇajaraṭhavraṇavibhrameṇa | kūpāvalīrvipulavīrarasāḥ pratāpaṃ hartuṃ dviṣāmiva ca kaścana sañcikāya || 9 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
व्यालोलतारकगतिर्विकसत्सरोज-श्रीसख्यवत्यरुणतामवलम्बमाना । कस्यापि चित्रमहह प्रमथाधिपस्य दृष्टिर्निशातमसिडम्बरमेव भेजे ॥ १० ॥ vyālolatārakagatirvikasatsaroja-śrīsakhyavatyaruṇatāmavalambamānā | kasyāpi citramahaha pramathādhipasya dṛṣṭirniśātamasiḍambarameva bheje || 10 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
संरूढरीढमरुणीभवदीक्षणान्त-कान्तिच्छटाघटनया क्षणमीक्षमाणः । आसन्नसङ्गरमहोत्सवशंसनाय सिन्दूरपूरमिव कोऽप्यकिरत्कृपाणे ॥ ११ ॥ saṃrūḍharīḍhamaruṇībhavadīkṣaṇānta-kānticchaṭāghaṭanayā kṣaṇamīkṣamāṇaḥ | āsannasaṅgaramahotsavaśaṃsanāya sindūrapūramiva ko'pyakiratkṛpāṇe || 11 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
दुःशिक्षिताखिलविपक्षदिधक्षयान्त-र्नेत्रेषु सङ्घटितपाटलिमोद्गमेषु । माहात्म्यतोऽन्तकरिपोरखिलास्तदोद्य-दाग्नेयदृष्टय इव प्रमथा बभुवुः ॥ १२ ॥ duḥśikṣitākhilavipakṣadidhakṣayānta-rnetreṣu saṅghaṭitapāṭalimodgameṣu | māhātmyato'ntakariporakhilāstadodya-dāgneyadṛṣṭaya iva pramathā babhuvuḥ || 12 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कश्चिन्निनाय पटुपाटलिमावमृष्टा दृष्टिच्छटास्तत इतः सुचिरं विमुञ्चन् । वक्तुं पुरः प्रतिभुवामशुभान्यनभ्र-विद्युद्घ​टाजटिलतामिव दिङ्मुखानि ॥ १३ ॥ kaścinnināya paṭupāṭalimāvamṛṣṭā dṛṣṭicchaṭāstata itaḥ suciraṃ vimuñcan | vaktuṃ puraḥ pratibhuvāmaśubhānyanabhra-vidyudghaṭājaṭilatāmiva diṅmukhāni || 13 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
धुन्वन्परः परुषरोषतयोत्तमाङ्गं प्रेङ्खोलकेलिमणिकुण्डलयुग्मभङ्ग्या । निन्ये निनर्तिषति वैरिकबन्धलोके सन्नद्धतालपुटतामिध वक्त्रचन्द्रम् ॥ १४ ॥ dhunvanparaḥ paruṣaroṣatayottamāṅgaṃ preṅkholakelimaṇikuṇḍalayugmabhaṅgyā | ninye ninartiṣati vairikabandhaloke sannaddhatālapuṭatāmidha vaktracandram || 14 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
आघट्टयन्करतलेन घनाभ्यसूयः कश्चिन्महीमुदितनूतनरन्ध्रयुक्त्या । सद्योऽतनोदिव मदाग्र्यधुराश्रितानां द्वारं विकस्वरमधोगतये परेषाम् ॥ १५ ॥ āghaṭṭayankaratalena ghanābhyasūyaḥ kaścinmahīmuditanūtanarandhrayuktyā | sadyo'tanodiva madāgryadhurāśritānāṃ dvāraṃ vikasvaramadhogataye pareṣām || 15 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
वीरोऽपरस्त्रिनयनानुचरः सरोषं मृद्नँल्ललाटफलकं करपङ्कजेन । दग्धुं रिपूननलमाशु ततो न्वियेष निर्मथ्य लब्धुमिव नेत्रदशाधिरूढम् ॥ १६ ॥ vīro'parastrinayanānucaraḥ saroṣaṃ mṛdna~llalāṭaphalakaṃ karapaṅkajena | dagdhuṃ ripūnanalamāśu tato nviyeṣa nirmathya labdhumiva netradaśādhirūḍham || 16 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
आकर्ण्य निर्णयमरातिमतप्रथाना-मारोहतोऽभिनवदुःसहरोषकोटिम् । चित्तेऽनवाप्य धृतिरुद्ध इवावकाशं कस्याप्यभूदधर एव दृढः प्रकम्पः ॥ १७ ॥ ākarṇya nirṇayamarātimataprathānā-mārohato'bhinavaduḥsaharoṣakoṭim | citte'navāpya dhṛtiruddha ivāvakāśaṃ kasyāpyabhūdadhara eva dṛḍhaḥ prakampaḥ || 17 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
धूमच्छटाप्रविकटभ्रुकुटीपुटस्य कस्यापि वेपथुसखोऽधरपल्लवोऽभूत् । उग्रोग्रनिःश्वसितमारुतघट्टनाभिः कोपानलस्य वलमान इव स्फुलिङ्गः ॥ १८ ॥ dhūmacchaṭāpravikaṭabhrukuṭīpuṭasya kasyāpi vepathusakho'dharapallavo'bhūt | ugrograniḥśvasitamārutaghaṭṭanābhiḥ kopānalasya valamāna iva sphuliṅgaḥ || 18 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
वर्षन्नजस्रमसमश्रमवारिबिन्दू-नाताम्रलोलनयनान्ततडित्कडारः । कश्चित्प्रनर्तयितुमुग्रकबन्धकेकि-लोकं स्पृहां व्यधित दिव्यधनुर्ग्रहाय ॥ १९ ॥ varṣannajasramasamaśramavāribindū-nātāmralolanayanāntataḍitkaḍāraḥ | kaścitpranartayitumugrakabandhakeki-lokaṃ spṛhāṃ vyadhita divyadhanurgrahāya || 19 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कस्यापि कोपधुतमूर्धविलोलमौलि-माल्योत्पतन्मधुपशावशतच्छलेन । घर्माम्बुतिम्यदलकस्थलरूढलोल-भ्रूवल्लरीनवफलावलिराविरासीत् ॥ २० ॥ kasyāpi kopadhutamūrdhavilolamauli-mālyotpatanmadhupaśāvaśatacchalena | gharmāmbutimyadalakasthalarūḍhalola-bhrūvallarīnavaphalāvalirāvirāsīt || 20 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
मथ्नन्मिथः करयुगं पृथुमन्युरन्यो भग्नोर्मिकारुणमणेः शकलैर्ववर्ष । निर्व्यूढगाढतरमत्सरनिर्जिहान-हव्याशनव्यवधिभाज इव स्फुलिङ्गान् ॥ २१ ॥ mathnanmithaḥ karayugaṃ pṛthumanyuranyo bhagnormikāruṇamaṇeḥ śakalairvavarṣa | nirvyūḍhagāḍhataramatsaranirjihāna-havyāśanavyavadhibhāja iva sphuliṅgān || 21 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
सन्ध्येव गण्डतलपाटलिमा परस्य प्रागाविरास्त तदनु भ्रुकुटीतमिस्रम् । पश्चात्ततोऽपि विचकास नवाट्टहास-ज्योत्स्ना विपक्षमुखपद्मनिरासहेतुः ॥ २२ ॥ sandhyeva gaṇḍatalapāṭalimā parasya prāgāvirāsta tadanu bhrukuṭītamisram | paścāttato'pi vicakāsa navāṭṭahāsa-jyotsnā vipakṣamukhapadmanirāsahetuḥ || 22 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
ऐक्षन्त वक्षसि नवश्रमवारिबिन्दू-नन्यस्य सम्भ्रमविशेषभुवो भुजिष्याः । कोपश्रियोऽतिचतुरं हृदये विशन्त्या मुक्तामणीनिव जवक्षतहारसूत्रान् ॥ २३ ॥ aikṣanta vakṣasi navaśramavāribindū-nanyasya sambhramaviśeṣabhuvo bhujiṣyāḥ | kopaśriyo'ticaturaṃ hṛdaye viśantyā muktāmaṇīniva javakṣatahārasūtrān || 23 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कश्चिद्बभार पुनरुक्तविपञ्च्यमान-रोमाञ्चसूचिसचिवं प्रमथप्रवीरः । तत्तत्समीकशतपीतचरारिखड्ग-खण्डोत्करोद्वमनसज्जमिवाङ्गमङ्गम् ॥ २४ ॥ kaścidbabhāra punaruktavipañcyamāna-romāñcasūcisacivaṃ pramathapravīraḥ | tattatsamīkaśatapītacarārikhaḍga-khaṇḍotkarodvamanasajjamivāṅgamaṅgam || 24 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कस्यापि पाणिकमले तरवारिलेखा भ्रूवल्लरी च सुमहत्यलिके चकम्पे । मालिन्यभूश्च कुटिला च मतिः परेषा-मुद्भूष्णुकम्पकलनास्त तयोस्तृतीया ॥ २५ ॥ kasyāpi pāṇikamale taravārilekhā bhrūvallarī ca sumahatyalike cakampe | mālinyabhūśca kuṭilā ca matiḥ pareṣā-mudbhūṣṇukampakalanāsta tayostṛtīyā || 25 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
आत्तः क्रुधा मृधविधानधृतानुबन्ध-मुद्वेपथुः पृथुरुचिभ्रुकुटीजटालः । केयूरलौहितकभाभिरगाहतेव खड्गोऽपि कस्यचन कोपविपाटलत्वम् ॥ २६ ॥ āttaḥ krudhā mṛdhavidhānadhṛtānubandha-mudvepathuḥ pṛthurucibhrukuṭījaṭālaḥ | keyūralauhitakabhābhiragāhateva khaḍgo'pi kasyacana kopavipāṭalatvam || 26 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
द्राङ्निप्रहन्तुमितरः समरे रिपूणां चक्रं चिरं चलयति स्म कराम्बुजेन । आवर्तमूर्तिरुदटङ्कि भुजोत्तरङ्ग-सङ्गस्य येन नवशौर्यमहार्णवस्य ॥ २७ ॥ drāṅniprahantumitaraḥ samare ripūṇāṃ cakraṃ ciraṃ calayati sma karāmbujena | āvartamūrtirudaṭaṅki bhujottaraṅga-saṅgasya yena navaśauryamahārṇavasya || 27 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
धाराजलह्रदपथाभिनवप्ररूढ-रक्तोत्पलव्यतिकरेव कृपाणलेखा । केनाप्यमन्थरमरच्यत मुच्यमान-रोषारुणारुणनिरङ्कुशदृष्टिपातैः ॥ २८ ॥ dhārājalahradapathābhinavaprarūḍha- raktotpalavyatikareva kṛpāṇalekhā | kenāpyamantharamaracyata mucyamāna- roṣāruṇāruṇaniraṅkuśadṛṣṭipātaiḥ || 28 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कश्चित्तथाप्रथितरोषभरं करेण वेगोद्धतं व्यधित कुट्टिमघट्टनानि । सद्यो यथा प्रथितनूतनरन्ध्रयोगा-त्त्रासेन भग्नहृदयेव धरापि जज्ञे ॥ २९ ॥ kaścittathāprathitaroṣabharaṃ kareṇa vegoddhataṃ vyadhita kuṭṭimaghaṭṭanāni | sadyo yathā prathitanūtanarandhrayogā-ttrāsena bhagnahṛdayeva dharāpi jajñe || 29 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कस्यापि वक्त्रमुदयात्परिपाटलश्रि मिश्रीकृतार्धमसिदीधितिधोरणीभिः । नाशैकपैशुनकृते द्विषतामकाण्ड-राहूपरागमिव कन्दलयाञ्चकार ॥ ३० ॥ kasyāpi vaktramudayātparipāṭalaśri miśrīkṛtārdhamasidīdhitidhoraṇībhiḥ | nāśaikapaiśunakṛte dviṣatāmakāṇḍa-rāhūparāgamiva kandalayāñcakāra || 30 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
आक्रन्दमावहदिवाविरतान्तराल-पारिप्लवभ्रमरसंहतिझाङ्कृतेन । प्रत्यर्थिवीरकमलागृहशङ्कयेव कश्चिद्बभञ्ज निजविभ्रमपुण्डरीकम् ॥ ३१ ॥ ākrandamāvahadivāviratāntarāla- pāriplavabhramarasaṃhatijhāṅkṛtena | pratyarthivīrakamalāgṛhaśaṅkayeva kaścidbabhañja nijavibhramapuṇḍarīkam || 31 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कोऽपि प्रकोपितमतिः परकिंवदन्त्या दन्त्याहवप्रसरसम्भृतसिंहवीर्यः । अङ्गैः समीकशतपीतचरारिखड्ग- धाराम्बु धर्मभरविभ्रमतो ववाम ॥ ३२ ॥ ko'pi prakopitamatiḥ parakiṃvadantyā dantyāhavaprasarasambhṛtasiṃhavīryaḥ | aṅgaiḥ samīkaśatapītacarārikhaḍga- dhārāmbu dharmabharavibhramato vavāma || 32 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कश्चित्पुरो विकिरति स्म विमृद्यमान-हस्तोर्मिकोत्करगलत्तपनीयचूर्णैः । उन्मूल्यमानपरिपन्थिरमानिकेत-पङ्केरुहप्रकरकेसररेणुपुञ्जम् ॥ ३३ ॥ kaścitpuro vikirati sma vimṛdyamāna-hastormikotkaragalattapanīyacūrṇaiḥ | unmūlyamānaparipanthiramāniketa-paṅkeruhaprakarakesarareṇupuñjam || 33 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कस्याप्यवेपत वपुः पुनरुक्तकोपा-टोपाकुलं गलदनर्गलघ​​र्मवारि । आसन्नसङ्गररसव्यसनानुषङ्गा-द्वीरश्रियेव हठतः परिरभ्यमाणम् ॥ ३४ ॥ kasyāpyavepata vapuḥ punaruktakopā-ṭopākulaṃ galadanargalagharmavāri | āsannasaṅgararasavyasanānuṣaṅgā-dvīraśriyeva haṭhataḥ parirabhyamāṇam || 34 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
श्यामोद्भ्रमद्भ्रुकुटि पाण्डुतराट्टहास-मुल्लासिशोणिमसखं च मुखं परस्य । कोपश्रियः सममिवारभतैणनाभि-नासीरपीतनरसैरनुलेपकेलिम् ॥ ३५ ॥ śyāmodbhramadbhrukuṭi pāṇḍutarāṭṭahāsa-mullāsiśoṇimasakhaṃ ca mukhaṃ parasya | kopaśriyaḥ samamivārabhataiṇanābhi-nāsīrapītanarasairanulepakelim || 35 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
दूरं प्रसार्य भुजदण्डयुगं मुखं च व्यादाय कश्चिदथ जृम्भणविभ्रमेषु । आकृष्य दिग्वलयतोऽखिलवैरिलोका-न्द्रागत्तुमारभत भैरवशिक्षयेव ॥ ३६ ॥ dūraṃ prasārya bhujadaṇḍayugaṃ mukhaṃ ca vyādāya kaścidatha jṛmbhaṇavibhrameṣu | ākṛṣya digvalayato'khilavairilokā-ndrāgattumārabhata bhairavaśikṣayeva || 36 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
दीर्यद्गभीरजरठव्रणरन्ध्रपुञ्ज-सञ्जातसंस्तवमुवाह परः शरीरम् । दोर्दण्डयष्टिकृतसन्निधिशौर्यकीर्ति-हंस्या यदातनुत विभ्रमपञ्जरत्वम् ॥ ३७ ॥ dīryadgabhīrajaraṭhavraṇarandhrapuñja- sañjātasaṃstavamuvāha paraḥ śarīram | dordaṇḍayaṣṭikṛtasannidhiśauryakīrti-haṃsyā yadātanuta vibhramapañjaratvam || 37 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
तेषां मुखेषु रिपुसैन्यमदान्धगन्ध-दन्तीन्द्रगण्डतटखण्डनचण्डचारः । भालस्थलोड्डमरलोलवलत्कराल-भ्रूवल्लरीभिरुदपुच्छयतेव कोपः ॥ ३८ ॥ teṣāṃ mukheṣu ripusainyamadāndhagandha-dantīndragaṇḍataṭakhaṇḍanacaṇḍacāraḥ | bhālasthaloḍḍamaralolavalatkarāla-bhrūvallarībhirudapucchayateva kopaḥ || 38 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
उन्मीलदर्घकणविभ्रमघ​र्मबिन्दु-दू(न्दु दू)रोल्लसद्भ्रुकुटिपद्धतिधूपधूमम् । क्रोधाधिदैवतमिवार्चिचदुच्चरिष्णु-शोणत्वरक्तवलिभिर्वदनं गणानाम् ॥ ३९ ॥ unmīladarghakaṇavibhramaghrmabindu-dū(ndu dū)rollasadbhrukuṭipaddhatidhūpadhūmam | krodhādhidaivatamivārcicaduccariṣṇu-śoṇatvaraktavalibhirvadanaṃ gaṇānām || 39 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
सञ्चुक्षुभे घटितघ​र्मजलेन चन्द्र-चूडामणेः सदसि कोपमहार्णवेन । आरक्तगण्डरुचिविद्रुमदण्डभाजो यस्यास्ति फेननिकुरम्ब इवाट्टहासः ॥ ४० ॥ sañcukṣubhe ghaṭitagharmajalena candra-cūḍāmaṇeḥ sadasi kopamahārṇavena | āraktagaṇḍarucividrumadaṇḍabhājo yasyāsti phenanikuramba ivāṭṭahāsaḥ || 40 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
तेषां तथोन्मिषितदुर्धररोषतिग्मं जग्मुस्तदा किमपि पाटलतां मुखानि । शम्भोर्यथादित तदंशुभरैरकाण्डे सन्ध्यानुबन्धमिव शेखरचन्द्रखण्डः ॥ ४१ ॥ teṣāṃ tathonmiṣitadurdhararoṣatigmaṃ jagmustadā kimapi pāṭalatāṃ mukhāni | śambhoryathādita tadaṃśubharairakāṇḍe sandhyānubandhamiva śekharacandrakhaṇḍaḥ || 41 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
सस्फारसारसहितप्रसरानुबन्ध-भाजोऽधिकं कमपि टङ्कयतः प्रचारम् । लोकस्य तस्य सरसोऽभिनवप्रकर्ष-श्चित्रं स्फुटत्वमनयन्नवकोपयोगम् ॥ ४२ ॥ sasphārasārasahitaprasarānubandha-bhājo'dhikaṃ kamapi ṭaṅkayataḥ pracāram | lokasya tasya saraso'bhinavaprakarṣa-ścitraṃ sphuṭatvamanayannavakopayogam || 42 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
अन्योन्यनिर्दयविघट्टनतोऽप्यखण्ड-चण्डाश्रिभिर्विवृतकोपभरै रदाग्रैः । भक्तो विभुं प्रति निरस्तसमस्तदम्भो दम्भोलिदन्तवददृश्यत पुष्पदन्तः ॥ ४३ ॥ anyonyanirdayavighaṭṭanato'pyakhaṇḍa-caṇḍāśribhirvivṛtakopabharai radāgraiḥ | bhakto vibhuṃ prati nirastasamastadambho dambholidantavadadṛśyata puṣpadantaḥ || 43 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
कोपग्रहोड्डमरनिर्भरघर्मगर्भ-रोमाञ्चकञ्चकपृथुश्वयथुप्ररोहः। बिभ्रच्छरीरमपि कीकसमात्रसार-मापीवराङ्ग इव भृङ्गिरिटिर्बभासे ॥ ४४ ॥ kopagrahoḍḍamaranirbharagharmagarbha-romāñcakañcakapṛthuśvayathuprarohaḥ | bibhraccharīramapi kīkasamātrasāra-māpīvarāṅga iva bhṛṅgiriṭirbabhāse || 44 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
निर्मृज्य भालफलकात्किरतो हरित्सु स्वेदाम्भसां सरभसं कणचक्रवालम् । नागाननस्य जघटे सलिलावगाहे केलिं विनापि करसीकरसर्गमार्गः ॥ ४५ ॥ nirmṛjya bhālaphalakātkirato haritsu svedāmbhasāṃ sarabhasaṃ kaṇacakravālam | nāgānanasya jaghaṭe salilāvagāhe keliṃ vināpi karasīkarasargamārgaḥ || 45 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
उद्भूष्णुना श्रमजलेन गजाननस्य सिन्दूररेणुरुदमृज्यत गण्डभित्तेः । आर्द्रप्रकोपजनितोऽथ स तत्र तस्य तत्कृत्यकृज्झटिति पाटलिमा बभूव ॥ ४६ ॥ udbhūṣṇunā śramajalena gajānanasya sindūrareṇurudamṛjyata gaṇḍabhitteḥ | ārdraprakopajanito'tha sa tatra tasya tatkṛtyakṛjjhaṭiti pāṭalimā babhūva || 46 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
झञ्झामरुत्सहचरं परुषं पुरस्ता-न्मुञ्चन्विनिःश्वसितडम्बरमग्निजन्मा । वर्षञ्श्रमाम्बुपृषतैश्च पृथुप्रकोपो नृत्तक्रियामकृत वाहनबर्हिणस्य ॥ ४७ ॥ jhañjhāmarutsahacaraṃ paruṣaṃ purastā-nmuñcanviniḥśvasitaḍambaramagnijanmā | varṣañśramāmbupṛṣataiśca pṛthuprakopo nṛttakriyāmakṛta vāhanabarhiṇasya || 47 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
ताम्रीभवन्मुखततिर्विततोज्जिहान-भ्रूभङ्गधूमलहरीविकरालिताशः। तापं किमप्यनुसरञ्शिखिभूरवाप तत्र स्वकारणगुणानुगुणामवस्थाम् ॥ ४८ ॥ tāmrībhavanmukhatatirvitatojjihāna-bhrūbhaṅgadhūmalaharīvikarālitāśaḥ| tāpaṃ kimapyanusarañśikhibhūravāpa tatra svakāraṇaguṇānuguṇāmavasthām || 48 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
प्रापत्करालतरवारिहठग्रहेण स्वच्छन्दतामविरतं विवशो ववल्ग । चित्राय विद्विषदुरस्तटवप्रकेलि-कल्लोलितोऽसकृदकल्प्यत वीरभद्रः ॥ ४९ ॥ prāpatkarālataravārihaṭhagraheṇa svacchandatāmavirataṃ vivaśo vavalga | citrāya vidviṣadurastaṭavaprakeli-kallolito'sakṛdakalpyata vīrabhadraḥ || 49 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
तण्डुः पुनः पुनरकाण्डकराभिघात-व्रातं विशन्नधिधरित्रि मदस्वतन्त्रः । स्वस्या भ्रुवोऽनुसृतलास्यरहस्यकेले-रुद्घ​ट्टयन्किमपि तालमिवावभासे ॥ ५० ॥ taṇḍuḥ punaḥ punarakāṇḍakarābhighāta-vrātaṃ viśannadhidharitri madasvatantraḥ | svasyā bhruvo'nusṛtalāsyarahasyakele-rudghaṭṭayankimapi tālamivāvabhāse || 50 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
द्वारावलीहठविशत्सुरलोकपाल-मालानिषेधविधिसन्ततशीलनेन । अभ्यस्तमाविरभवत्स्वयमश्रमेण भ्रूलास्यकर्म सहसैव शिलादसूनोः ॥ ५१ ॥ dvārāvalīhaṭhaviśatsuralokapāla-mālāniṣedhavidhisantataśīlanena | abhyastamāvirabhavatsvayamaśrameṇa bhrūlāsyakarma sahasaiva śilādasūnoḥ || 51 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
क्ष्मापीठपृष्ठमपि घट्टयतोऽतिवेल-मुद्वेलमत्सररसप्लवमानदृष्टेः । अभ्यासतो मुरजवादनविभ्रमेषु नो नन्दिनः करतलं श्रममाससाद ॥ ५२ ॥ kṣmāpīṭhapṛṣṭhamapi ghaṭṭayato'tivela-mudvelamatsararasaplavamānadṛṣṭeḥ | abhyāsato murajavādanavibhrameṣu no nandinaḥ karatalaṃ śramamāsasāda || 52 || महेश्वरलोकस्थस्य पितुराज्ञया स्वप्ने श्रुतया विबुधस्तुतं तच्छ्रीकण्ठचरितं काव्यं भगवते निवेद्य स मङ्खको मनसि कमप्यानन्दं प्रकाशयति ॥ Having thus composed this poem - highly acclaimed by poets and scholars for its faultless execution – by the command of his father - a denizen of Shiva’s divine abode - who appeared in his dream, Mankha cherishes a rare contentment in his heart. Devotees worship Shiva by pouring sugarcane juice and milk over his image and prostrating before it (JR).
